entities: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions on Western Sahara, reaffirms support for the Secretary-General's efforts to implement resolutions 1754 (2007) and 1783 (2007). 

It reaffirms commitment to assist parties to achieve a just, lasting, and mutually acceptable political solution providing for self-determination of Western Sahara's people. 

The Council calls on parties and regional States to cooperate with the UN and each other to end the impasse and achieve progress towards a political solution. 

Noting Moroccan and Polisario Front proposals, it welcomes progress in direct negotiations and agreement to explore family visits by land. 

The Council urges parties to continue negotiations without preconditions and in good faith, with a view to achieving a just, lasting, and mutually acceptable political solution.

It requests the Secretary-General to keep the Council informed on negotiations' status and progress. 

The Council extends the mandate of MINURSO until 30 April 2009 and requests a report on the situation in Western Sahara before the mandate period ends.

 It urges Member States to provide voluntary contributions to fund Confidence Building Measures. 

The Council decides to remain seized of the matter.
